author: Rebecca Lau
description: Vanessa Schiliro, a marine biology student at Dalhousie University, wants to educate the public about how to avoid shark encounters and what to do if you come across one.
title: How to avoid great white sharks and what to do if you encounter one | Globalnews.ca
content: Great white sharks typically return to Atlantic Canadian waters around this time of year, and their presence has been captivating people around the Maritimes recently, due in part to efforts to tag a… [+5060 chars]

author: Brian Bradley - Toronto Star

title: Top 10 reads for Pride month
content: For some, Pride month is the time to hit the streets and celebrate who we are. That may take you to a patio, a nightclub, a drag show and, yes, the big parade. Pride is also a time for reflection at … [+6205 chars]

author: Joshua Chong - Staff Reporter
description: As prices hit new highs at No Frills, Food Basics, FreshCo and other discount grocery stores, Canada’s most vulnerable are turning to food banks in droves. Some say, eventually, those prices will hit a wall.
title: Shoppers say the deals at Canada’s discount grocers are gone — but there may be some relief soon
content:
Call it the great food migration. 
As food prices continue their record surge, shoppers are swarming to discount supermarkets in search of savings.

author: Marco Chown Oved - Climate Change Reporter
description: As food prices have risen, so have the profits at Canada’s three largest supermarket chains. None of the three dispute their margins have grown, but all say attributing gains to increased markups is “simply inaccurate.”
title: Supermarkets are hiking prices faster than necessary — and profiting from inflation, Star investigation suggests
content:
For retired child-care worker Kim Agnew, inflation means putting TV dinners in her cart instead of meat.
“It’s terrible. It was $13.50 for a pack of chicken thighs, but the frozen dinners were only … [+18738 chars]
